intro: Daviesia physodes, commonly known as the pink-flowered daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of local ecosystems. Daviesia physodes is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
